thread.title: Citigroup’s ‘Bad Bank’ Isn’t So Bad Anymore
thread.title_full: Citigroup’s ‘Bad Bank’ Isn’t So Bad Anymore

title: Citigroup’s ‘Bad Bank’ Isn’t So Bad Anymore
text:
Markets Citigroup’s ‘Bad Bank’ Isn’t So Bad Anymore Citi Holdings, the ‘bad bank’ Citigroup created to dispose of unwanted assets, has become a surprise success story By Aug. 12, 2015 6:03 p.m. ET 
Citi Holdings was born to be bad. But it is getting better with age. 
The “bad-bank” unit of Citigroup Inc., Citi Holdings for more than six years has been the repository for businesses the banking giant wanted to dump: its retail brokerage and life insurance unit, an array of toxic subprime loans, even a stake in a Mexican auto supplier. ... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
